paper_abstract: We study the random graph G 4 conditioned on the event that all vertex degrees he in some given subset S of the nonnegative interacts. Subject to a certain hypothesis on S. the empirical distribution of the vertex degrees is asymptotically Poisson with some parameter (mu) over cap men as the root of a certain "characteristic equation" of S that maximizes a certain function psi s(mu) Subject to a hypothesis on S. we obtain a partial description of the structure of such a random graph, including a condition for the existence (or not) of a giant component The requisite hypothesis is in many cases benign. and applications are presented to a number of choices for the set S including the sets of (respectively) even and odd numbers (C) 2010 Wiley Periodicals. Inc Random Struct Alg, 37, 137-175. 2010
paper_title: Random Graphs with Forbidden Vertex Degrees
